itemDescription: British lawyer and judge who served as the Chief Justice of the Straits Settlements

wikipedia_page.main: Sir Walter Sidney Shaw (15 April 1863 – 24 April 1937) was an English lawyer and judge in the early 20th century. He served as a judge in a number of British colonies, his last judicial appointment being the Chief Justice of the Straits Settlements. He was also the chairman of the Shaw Commission which investigated the 1929 Palestine riots.
